metadata.title: CVE-2022-24806 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
net-snmp provides various tools relating to the Simple Network ManagementProtocol. Prior to version 5.9.2, a user with read-write credentials canexploit an Improper Input Validation vulnerability when SETing malformedOIDs in master agent and subagent simultaneously. Version 5.9.2 contains apatch. Users should use strong SNMPv3 credentials and avoid sharing thecredentials. Those who must use SNMPv1 or SNMPv2c should use a complexcommunity string and enhance the protection by restricting access to agiven IP address range.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetsnmptrapd40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp-base - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp-perl - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmp - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmpd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmptrapd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
tkmib - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2').
